explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_liquids.hazard_statement: Flammable liquid and vapour; Combustible liquid
flammable_liquids.rationale: Flash point data available from materials are distributed in both Category 3 and 4. Therefore, if the flash point is not measured with a real sample, it cannot be judged. The acceptance criteria are as follows: Category 3: 23 degC<= flash point <=60 degC; Category4: 60 degC< flash point <=93 degC

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive or self-reactive properties present in the molecule.

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures, which in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive or self-reactive properties present in the molecule.

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing chlorine (but not oxygen and fluorine) chemically bonded only to carbon and hydrogen (but not to other elements).

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Category 3 based on SPECIES: Rat; ENDPOINT: LD50; VALUE: :75mg/kg; , 105mg/kg and 150mg/kg; REFERENCE SOURCE: PATTY 4th (1994)

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: It was set as Category 3 based on rabbit LD50 value: 870mg/kg (ATSDR, 1989).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: Based on Rat LC50 (4 hours) value: 20 ppm (CaPSAR, 2005), it could be judged from vapor pressure as the steam with almost no mist, and classified by the ppm concentration standard as Category 1.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: It was set as Category 2 from description that irritation was admitted in the test applied to the skin of the rabbit (ATSDR (1989)).

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: We classified it as Category 2B based on the descriptions that moderate ocular change was acknowledged which recovers within 24 hours in the tests applied to the eyes of the rabbits (ACGIH (7th, 2001) and PATTY (4th, 1994)).

respiratory_skin_sensitizer.classification: Respiratory sensitization: Classification not possible; Skin sensitization: Classification not possible
respiratory_skin_sensitizer.rationale: Respiratory organ: No data. Skin: Since data was insufficient, we could not classify it.

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: There is a negative result (IARC 71, 1999, ATSDR, 1989) by joint examination with rat liver DNA which is an in vivo genotoxicity study using a somatic cell, and there is no positive finding of several indices by an in vitro mutagenicity test. So it cannot classify.

carcinogenicity.rationale: It was classified into B-2 (IRIS, 2005) in EPA (1994) and category 3 (EU-Annex I, 2005) in EU. But it was classified into a group 3 (IARC 71, 1999) in IARC and A4 (ACGIH 7th, 2001) in ACGIH. So it was considered as the outside of Category according to ACGIH which is latest assessment document, .

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: Cause damage to organs (respiratory organs); May cause respiratory irritation or may cause drowsiness and dizziness (narcotic effects)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: From description in ACGIH (7th, 2001), PATTY (4th, 1994), CaPSAR (2005), ATSDR (1989), Society for Occupational Health Recommendation of Occupational Exposure (1993), and IARC 71 (1999) that the violent irritation against respiratory tracts is seen in humans, and from description in ACGIH (7th, 2001), PATTY (4th, 1994), and ATSDR (1989) that death from lung damage was seen in the inhalation exposure test using guinea pigs. So it was set as Category 1 (respiratory tracts) . Moreover, description in Society for Occupational Health Recommendation of Occupational Exposure (1993) that an anesthetic actions is seen in high concentrations, and from description in PATTY (4th, 1994) and ATSDR (1989) that unconsciousness was seen in the inhalation exposure test using guinea pigs. So it was set as Category 3 (anesthetic actions).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the description that toxicity was not observed with the concentration of the guidance value range of Category 2 in the inhalation exposure test for 130 days using the rats and guinea pigs (ACGIH (7th, 2001), PATTY (4th, 1994) and ATSDR (1989)), there was a possibility that it was Out Of Category, however, it was the examination of only single exposure concentration, so relation between dosage and toxicity etc. otherwise is not clear, and there is no such description that data and hazards are very low that clearly reports hazardousness, therefore we presupposed that we could not classify since the data is insufficient.

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It carried out the outside of Category from 96-hour LC50>100mg/L of fishes (Oryzias latipes) (MOE eco-toxicity tests of chemicals, 1996).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since not water-insoluble (water solubility=17200mg/L(PHYSPROP Database, 2005)) and acute toxicity is low.
